intro: Erycibe strigosa, commonly known as the rough erycibe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and large, palmate leaves. Its showy flowers, which are typically pink or red, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Erycibe strigosa is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
